entries.title: India hopes its new electronic payment method will conquer the world
entries.description: The Unified Payments Interface (UPI), a real-time transaction platform that has become increasingly popular in India, could potentially compete with the global interbank network SWIFT.

entries.title: Mudslides and sinkholes after major rainfalls in California
entries.description: Unrelenting since the beginning of January, rain in California has caused 19 deaths and significant damage. While there have been no fatalities in Los Angeles, it has not been spared from extensive damage.

entries.title: French movies are flopping abroad
entries.description: In 2022, French movies attracted 27 million spectators outside France, a result that has fallen sharply compared to the decade pre-Covid.

entries.title: Lawyers find more classified documents at Joe Biden's home
entries.description: White House lawyer Richard Sauber said he found the remaining material on Thursday after Joe Biden's personal lawyers stopped their search when they found one page on Wednesday.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: Russian missiles hit multiple cities, UK to supply tanks
entries.description: Five people were killed and more than 20 were wounded in the city of Dnipro on Saturday, after a Russian missile struck an apartment building.

entries.title: Some Bolsonaro supporters point the finger after January 8 riots
entries.description: While the legal system closes in on the former head of state, some Bolsonaro supporters who disapprove of the violence on January 8 want to believe thugs infiltrated the riots.

entries.title: Greek court drops espionage charges against 24 aid workers who helped migrants in Lesbos
entries.description: After more than four years of waiting, some of the espionage charges against the 24 defendants were dropped, although they still face charges of money laundering and human smuggling.

entries.title: Greta Thunberg joins thousands protesting German coal mine expansion
entries.description: Thousands of people, including Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg, demonstrated in persistent rain on Saturday to protest the demolition of a village in Germany.

entries.title: Three frontrunners as Czechs vote for new president
entries.description: The winner of the Czech election will replace Milos Zemon, a divisive leader.

entries.title: US and China face off in raging semiconductor battle
entries.description: The most powerful chips have become a key feature of both civilian and military electronics. Fearing that Beijing could dominate the sector, Washington launched an unprecedented wave of sanctions against China, in a sign protectionism is back.

entries.title: The differences between Biden, Trump classified documents
entries.description: There are few similarities and many differences. Both cases involve the discovery of documents that should have been handed over to the archives, but the facts and the quantities involved are not comparable.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: 'We're seeing the 21st-century version of the battle of Verdun'
entries.description: In an interview with 'Le Monde', Andriy Yermak, Volodymyr Zelensky's right-hand man, takes stock of the military situation in Ukraine.

entries.title: Benjamin Mendy trial: Manchester City footballer partially cleared of rape charges
entries.description: The French footballer was found not guilty on Friday of six rapes and one sexual assault. There will be a new trial in June for another rape and attempted rape.

entries.title: China reports almost 60,000 Covid-related deaths
entries.description: The death toll of 59,938 Covid-related deaths included deaths caused by the disease and fatalities from other ailments combined with Covid-19.

entries.title: Alireza Akbari: Iran executes British-Iranian national over spy claim
entries.description: Iran said Saturday it had executed a dual Iranian-British national who once held a high-ranking position in the country's defense ministry despite international warnings to halt his death sentence.

entries.title: Fentanyl, the drug that is ravaging the United States
entries.description: Every seven minutes, on average, one person dies from the effects of this inexpensive synthetic product. Fifty times more lethal than heroin, it was originally created to relieve cancer patients.

entries.title: 'Olympe de Gouges, an exemplary symbol of feminism and humanism, must join the Pantheon'
entries.description: A group of historians, writers and elected officials demand the transfer of the remains to the Paris Pantheon of Olympe de Gouges, a pioneer in the fight for the abolition of slavery and women's rights.

entries.title: Drugmakers face challenges to repatriate production to France
entries.description: Pharmaceutical companies are reluctant to further invest in production lines in France. They argue the final price of medicines there is too low.

entries.title: Little Simz, freer than ever with 'No Thank You'
entries.description: After winning a Brit Award and the Mercury Prize, the rapper has released a fifth album in which she reiterates her desire for independence and her musical research.

entries.title: In Peru, the quality of higher education is at risk
entries.description: Powerful lobbies are trying to bury an education reform law that brought order to the business of lower-quality private universities.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: Five Russian refugees stuck in an airport terminal in South Korea
entries.description: Five young people fleeing the 'partial mobilization' wait in the boarding area of Incheon airport after their asylum applications were rejected.

entries.title: Top Brazil court authorizes probe of Bolsonaro for Jan. 8 riot
entries.description: Justice Alexandre de Moraes granted the request from the prosecutor-general's office, which cited a video Mr. Bolsonaro posted on Facebook that contested the election results.

entries.title: Ukraine's war effort is evident in its metallurgical sector in Zaporizhzhia
entries.description: On the huge Zaporizhstal site near the front line, workers produce bullet-proof vest plates and underground bunkers for soldiers.

entries.title: Imam Iquioussen deported to Morocco after several judicial twists
entries.description: The 58-year-old, who was initially targeted for deportation in France for 'inciting hatred and discrimination,' had fled to Belgium, where he was arrested.
